intro: Hartogia humilis, commonly known as the dwarf hartogia, is a low-growing perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, which bloom during the summer months. Hartogia humilis thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in rocky or coastal environments. Its unique morphology and adaptability make it a distinctive addition to arid and semi-arid landscapes.
